channel.title: Comments on: World of Warcraft Patch 2.2 …

item.title: By: Laura
item.dc:creator: Laura
item.description:
The one time I tried voice chat on the PTR it was really quiet. Not sure if I just didn't have the settings right or what. Of course, it was really late on a Saturday after a raid and I was pretty drunk at the time.
Hmmm...drunk, tired raiders doing beta testing. Maybe that's Blizz's trouble with patching.
item.content:encoded:
The one time I tried voice chat on the PTR it was really quiet. Not sure if I just didn’t have the settings right or what. Of course, it was really late on a Saturday after a raid and I was pretty drunk at the time.

Hmmm…drunk, tired raiders doing beta testing. Maybe that’s Blizz’s trouble with patching.

item.title: By: Foton
item.dc:creator: Foton
item.description:
<blockquote>Or leave the 'Family General Channel' at Thanksgiving.</blockquote>
HAHA!
item.content:encoded:
Or leave the ‘Family General Channel’ at Thanksgiving.

HAHA!

item.title: By: Puhase
item.dc:creator: Puhase
item.description:
I predict I will get a very bad finger cramp from mouse clicking the mute button.
But then again, I desperately want in real life the functions I have in WoW to separate out the annoying people.
Imagine if you could "Report Spam" the guy asking you for change everyday on your walk to work. Or leave the "Family General Channel" at Thanksgiving. Life would get a little more livable imo.
item.content:encoded:
I predict I will get a very bad finger cramp from mouse clicking the mute button.

But then again, I desperately want in real life the functions I have in WoW to separate out the annoying people.

Imagine if you could “Report Spam” the guy asking you for change everyday on your walk to work. Or leave the “Family General Channel” at Thanksgiving. Life would get a little more livable imo.
